titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Renee Cote papers 1984-1987 LSC.2197
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2014; Sabrina Ponce, 2017; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 20 November 2017.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-20T10:23-0800

did.abstract: Renee Cote was a psychotherapist and lesbian activist. This collection includes the thesis for her master's degree as well as an additional publication.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and French.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Renee Cote papers (Collection 2197). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, 2014. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2017.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Renee Cote was a psychotherapist and lesbian activist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection includes Renee Cote's Master's Thesis, "From 49 to -9: The Beginnings of my Recovery as an ACMIP" submitted in March 1987 to Vermont College of Norwich University. Also included is a copy of "La Journee internationale des femmes" by Renee Cote, published in 1984.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.
controlaccess.subject: Lesbian activists--United States--Archives.
Psychotherapists--United States--Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A copy of La Journee internationale des femmes and "The Beginnings of my Recovery as an ACMIP," both by Renee Cote.
